title: RAINBOW ROAD
body_text:
Body bruising, nut crushing, mentally impairing -
The YEAR-END DOUBLE HEADER!
Friday's DODGEBALL 118
Player's Choice Rimshot Contest
Weeks of boiling anticipation had come to a head for Part 1 of this year-end double showdown. No captains were announced, little information distributed or posted, nothing. This 118th melee could perhaps best be summed "Trial and Error" - let's just see what happens!
The opening contest of the evening was not your standard two-team war, but rather a winner-take-all
Player's Choice Rimshot Contest
. Warriors had their eye on the prize - the right to form teams any way he/she saw fit. Indeed it was winner-take-all, especially for the loose cannon
Travis Mills
, the eventual victor and decision maker for this 23rd
Wet War
.
"Maniac" Mills would go on to assemble two evenly-matched squads, one named CORBA KI, the other STRIKE FORCE. But judging by the occurrences that had already transpired, it was a safe bet this wouldn't be your traditional two-team encounter, oh no. By the end of eight,
BoxBall Dodgeball
,
Prison Ball
, and even
FullCourt Dodgeball
would all see action.
Flash Results by Game
:
Cobra Ki defeated Strike Force, 6 - 2
COBRA KI: 2, 3, 5-P, 6-P, 7-BB, 8-FC
STRIKE FORCE: 1, 4
("P" = Prison Ball, "BB" = BoxBall Dodgeball, "FC" = FullCourt Dodgeball)
Clearcut winners in this one as the deadly assassins COBRA KI knock off their adversaries 6 to 2. The reintroduction of
Prison Ball
and
BoxBall
and the newly-created
FullCourt
war served as the Force's downfall.
Moments & Stars
: Travis Mills, Kevin Megill, Juan Londono, and Marc Spirito's "spontaneous humming"; Bobby Bonney receiving some nasty bodyshots; Diana DiBuccio's game-winning eliminations while sagging; Mike "Sputz" Krott and John Tronolone engaging in an event-long rivalry; several players parading around in the oversized Ron Paul sign
Look What Else You Missed!
Even before Cobra Ki and Strike Force got it on, combatants went all out in several rare showdowns featuring one game in which players used their opposite throwing arm only to be followed by two rounds of the comedic, though strenuous Dodgeball Battle Royal that ultimately set the stage for the three-hour "WWE Championship" brawl.
RECORDS of 118
> Attendance: 21
> Notable Returns: Sara DeCuir (last competed at DB CX3); Marc Spirito (last competed at DB CX3); Bobby Bonney (last competed at DB 114)
> New Players: (1) Cocoa Driscoll*
- DODGEBALL 118 was
Wet War XXIII
and the first Friday event since DODGEBALL 50 in early-August 2006.
- Travis Mills won the first-ever
Player's Choice Rimshot Contest
, earning the right to form teams and providing team names (Corba Ki and Strike Force).
- This was the first event to feature Prison Ball and BoxBall Dodgeball on the same night. Add in another "first" with the new FullCourt Dodgeball during Game 8.
- The supposed "WWE Title Chase" allowed combatants to aim for a certain player or "champion" all throughout 118. John Tronolone won the Battle Royal and the right to be named the inaugural champ and by the end of 118, "chase" winner Mike Edwards ended up carrying the gold.
- *Cocoa Driscoll is the first dog to ever compete in the game of dodgeball.
Saturday's DODGEBALL 119
Megill vs. Wolf
No fancy team names or stipulations in this second part of an already grueling Double Header. The ever-powerful, imposing southpaw Kevin Megill. The quick-witted, blocking magician Justin Wolf. Two fierce warriors with absolutely nothing in common except the undying desire to win! What an extraordinary way to cap off 2007!
Though the bad blood between the two isn't at all prevelent, it was really only a matter of time before these iron men faced off. The icon Megill took Game 1 in this year-end slaughter, barely besting the
ROOKIE of the Year
contender.
Next round, same result.
Game 3, yet another triumph for the the award-winning left-hander.
The nail in the coffin reared its ugly "head" in the fourth, Wolf now at a distinct disadvantage. Megill was just one tough customer to deal with and although "Punter" Wolf finally managed to get on the board, Megill steam rolled through the competition.
Flash Results by Game
:
Kevin Megill defeated Justin Wolf, 5 - 2
Megill: 1, 2, 3, 4, 7
Wolf: 5, 6
Each and every round came down to the wire and could have gone either way. The Last Man Standing three-minute clock actually winded down in both Games 1 and 8. In the very end however, it was Team MEGILL that pulled ahead and kept the multi-point advantage. Big ups to both captains who just the night before, competed to the best of their ability.
Moments & Stars
: Michael Butler, Chris Daly, and Tom Adams viciously nailed in the groin; the odd smell of propane; Chris Adams and Chris Daly participaing without footwear
Injury Update
Returning to action at Saturday's DODGEBALL 119 was the one and only, "The Big Kat" Zach Katz. He may be wishing he made other plans because in the early-goings, Katz slipped and fell backwards severely spraining his ankle. As a result, "The Big Kat" will be using the assistance of crutches for a few days. It'll only be a matter of time before this wily veteran makes his way back to the Wall High School battlegrounds.
RECORDS of 119
> Attendance: 25
> Notable Returns: Chris Daly (last competed at DB 84); Chris Grasso (last competed at DB 100); Zach Katz (last competed at DB CVII); Steve Adams (last competed at DB CX1)
> New Players: (2) Christina Rodriguez, Kelly Oberto
- DODGEBALL 119 was the last event held in the 2007 year.
- Kevin Megill defeated Justin Wolf, 5 to 2 in the night's main event. Megill moves to 5-1-1 while Wolf stands at 1-1-0.
.............
Double Header History
The list of previous multiple event weekends: DAY 1 & DAY 2 (9.3.05 & 9.4.05); XONE & XTWO (11.4.05 & 11.5.05); 18 & 19 (12.16.05 & 12.17.05); XXX4 & 35* (4.7.06 & 4.9.06)
*Took place on a Friday and Sunday.
A Real Test of Endurance
It takes a great deal of physical stamina and mental strength to partake in any one of the single Saturday brawls. But two straight nights of battering, bruising dodgeball? Only the strong indeed survive.
Hats off to the following competitors who fought tooth and nail for the entire durations of both DODGEBALL 118 and DODGEBALL 119: Bobby Vetrano, Diana DiBuccio, John Tronolone, Juan Londono, Justin Wolf, Kevin Megill, Melissa Kerr, and Mike "Sputz" Krott.
Chris Adams, Grant Cornero, Kevin Adams, Mike Edwards, Ryan Letsche, and Tom Adams also showcased their talents throughout the two-day journey.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Arguably the most dominant figures of the last 12 months take their rightful place in the ten event spotlight.
PLAYER of the Year
candidate
Ryan Letsche
meets
ROOKIE of the Year
nominee
Grant Cornero
at the one and only DODGEBALL CXX. And that's not all!
The votes are in! Who will walk away with a prestigious
Gold Award
? Find out
January 5
during the live trophy presentation.
A high-octane soundtrack, a 50/50 raffle, and even an Afterparty! Start time is
6pm
!
Remember to check back later in the week for the preview!

Body bruising, nut crushing, mentally impairing -
The YEAR-END DOUBLE HEADER!

Friday's DODGEBALL 118

The opening contest of the evening was not your standard two-team war, but rather a winner-take-all Player's Choice Rimshot Contest. Warriors had their eye on the prize - the right to form teams any way he/she saw fit. Indeed it was winner-take-all, especially for the loose cannon Travis Mills, the eventual victor and decision maker for this 23rd Wet War.

"Maniac" Mills would go on to assemble two evenly-matched squads, one named CORBA KI, the other STRIKE FORCE. But judging by the occurrences that had already transpired, it was a safe bet this wouldn't be your traditional two-team encounter, oh no. STRIKE FORCE: 1, 4
("P" = Prison Ball, "BB" = BoxBall Dodgeball, "FC" = FullCourt Dodgeball)

Clearcut winners in this one as the deadly assassins COBRA KI knock off their adversaries 6 to 2. The reintroduction of Prison Ball and BoxBall and the newly-created FullCourt war served as the Force's downfall.

As a result, "The Big Kat" will be using the assistance of crutches for a few days. It'll only be a matter of time before this wily veteran makes his way back to the Wall High School battlegrounds.

> Attendance: 25
> Notable Returns: Chris Daly (last competed at DB 84); Chris Grasso (last competed at DB 100); Zach Katz (last competed at DB CVII); Steve Adams (last competed at DB CX1)
> New Players: (2) Christina Rodriguez, Kelly Oberto

- DODGEBALL 119 was the last event held in the 2007 year.
- Kevin Megill defeated Justin Wolf, 5 to 2 in the night's main event. Megill moves to 5-1-1 while Wolf stands at 1-1-0.

.............

The list of previous multiple event weekends: DAY 1 & DAY 2 (9.3.05 & 9.4.05); XONE & XTWO (11.4.05 & 11.5.05); 18 & 19 (12.16.05 & 12.17.05); XXX4 & 35* (4.7.06 & 4.9.06)

Arguably the most dominant figures of the last 12 months take their rightful place in the ten event spotlight. PLAYER of the Year candidate Ryan Letsche meets ROOKIE of the Year nominee Grant Cornero at the one and only DODGEBALL CXX. And that's not all!

The votes are in! Who will walk away with a prestigious Gold Award? Find out January 5 during the live trophy presentation.

A high-octane soundtrack, a 50/50 raffle, and even an Afterparty! Start time is 6pm!
Remember to check back later in the week for the preview!
